title: Orthodontic Assistant - Queens Based
description:
At NYFD, we are a trailblazing company at the forefront of dentistry. We foster a collaborative and inclusive work culture, encouraging fresh ideas and empowering our employees to achieve their full potential. As an orthodontic assistant you will play a pivotal role in driving our continued success. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the organizational workflow and work alongside a team of talented professionals who are dedicated to pushing boundaries and delivering exceptional results.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* taking their medical history, explaining the treatment process, and addressing any concerns or questions they may have.
* assist the orthodontist during procedures by providing instruments, materials, and equipment required for the treatment. They should also ensure the patient's comfort and safety throughout the procedure.
* taking dental X-rays and impressions of patients' teeth. They should be proficient in operating X-ray machines, following safety protocols, and ensuring accurate and clear images.
* should adhere to strict infection control protocols, sterilize instruments, clean treatment areas, and maintain a safe and hygienic working environment.
* should maintain patient records, update treatment progress notes, and document any necessary information related to the procedures performed.
* educate patients on proper oral hygiene practices, including brushing, flossing, and caring for their orthodontic appliances. They should also provide instructions on the use of orthodontic appliances and answer any questions related to treatment.

  


**Why Join New York Family Dentistry:**

**Meaningful Impact:** Be part of a company that is transforming dentistry.


**Innovative Environment:** Work with cutting-edge technology and collaborate with industry experts to drive groundbreaking solutions.


**Growth Opportunities:** We invest in our employees' professional development and provide ample opportunities for advancement and learning.


**Collaborative Culture:** Join a diverse, welcoming and inclusive team that values collaboration, creativity, and open communication.

* Team celebrations and quarterly meetings

**Competitive Compensation and Benefits:** We offer a highly competitive salary package, comprehensive benefits, and additional perks to reward your hard work.️

* Salary: starting at $20-26 per hour depending on experience
* Benefits Package Available
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday
  




**Requirements:**


To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and attributes:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* CPR or X Ray certification
* Completion of a dental assistant program or equivalent training
* Experience working in an orthodontic or dental office

title: Oral Surgeon - Part Time, Once a week!
description:
**Join Our Team at New York Family Dentistry: Experience the Future of Oral Health Care!**


New York Family Dentistry is excited to expand our services to include Oral Surgery alongside top-notch general dentistry. As our organization evolves, we're seeking passionate individuals to join us in making a difference in the lives of our patients.

**Why Join Us?**


* Earn a competitive salary ranging from $500,000 to $999,000 annually, with bonus incentives to reward your hard work and dedication.
* Access cutting-edge dental technology that empowers you to provide the highest quality care and stay at the forefront of your field.
* Serve a diverse and dynamic patient base in Brooklyn and Queens, including under-served populations, providing you with a rewarding and fulfilling experience.
* Make a meaningful impact by providing essential oral health care to those who may not otherwise have access to it, ensuring equitable treatment for all.
* Work alongside a dedicated support team focused on patient care, in a collaborative and nurturing environment that emphasizes team training and development.


**About the Role**


As a part-time Oral Surgeon at New York Family Dentistry, you'll have the opportunity to leverage your clinical expertise and interpersonal skills to provide exceptional oral health care. Join a team that prioritizes patient well-being and values effective collaboration among dental professionals.

**Ideal Candidate Qualities**


* Compassionate and patient-centric approach to care
* Strong communication skills and problem-solving aptitude
* Detail-oriented mindset with excellent time management and multitasking abilities


**Requirements**


* Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) or Doctor of Dental Medicine (DMD) degree from an accredited dental school.
* Completion of an accredited oral and maxillofacial surgery residency program.
* Active state dental license, with specific licensure required for the state where the practice is located.
* Board certification or eligibility for certification by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery (ABOMS) or equivalent certification body.
* Proficiency in a wide range of oral surgical procedures, including but not limited to tooth extractions, dental implants, jaw surgeries, and oral pathology management.
* Experience in administering anesthesia and sedation for surgical procedures.
* Willingness to stay updated on advancements in oral and maxillofacial surgery techniques and technologies through continuing education and professional development activities.
* Compliance with all relevant legal and ethical standards in the practice of oral surgery.


**Ready to Join Us?**


If you're passionate about delivering high-quality dental care and thrive in a supportive and welcoming environment, we invite you to apply for our part-time Oral Surgeon position. To submit your application, please send your resume and cover letter. We eagerly anticipate hearing from you and welcoming you to our team!

title: Pediatric Dental Assistant - Queens Based
description:
Are you passionate about providing quality dental care to children? Do you have a warm and friendly demeanor that puts young patients at ease? We have an exciting opportunity for a Pediatric Dental Assistant to join our dedicated team and make a positive impact on the oral health of our youngest patients.


At New York Family Dentistry, we are committed to delivering exceptional dental care in a comfortable and welcoming environment. Our team of professionals is dedicated to ensuring children have positive dental experiences, setting the foundation for a lifetime of good oral health.


As a Pediatric Dental Assistant, you will play a crucial role in providing support to our pediatric dentist and ensuring that each child's visit is smooth and enjoyable. Your responsibilities will include:

* Assisting the pediatric dentist during dental procedures, including examinations, cleanings, and treatments.
* Preparing treatment rooms and ensuring they are well-stocked and sanitized.
* Welcoming young patients and their families, helping to create a friendly and reassuring atmosphere.
* Educating children and their parents on proper oral hygiene techniques.
* Taking digital X-rays and maintaining accurate patient records.
* Sterilizing and maintaining dental instruments and equipment.
* Providing chairside assistance to the dentist, anticipating their needs and ensuring patient comfort.
* Offering support to children who may be anxious or nervous about dental procedures.
* Adhering to infection control protocols and maintaining a safe environment for patients and staff.
* Participating in team meetings and continuing education opportunities to stay up-to-date with best practices.

  


**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Completion of an accredited dental assisting program.
* Pediatric dental experience is preferred but not required; willingness to learn and work with children is essential.
* X-ray certification.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, especially when interacting with children and parents.
* Organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team.

  


**Benefits:** We offer a competitive compensation package along with the following benefits:

* Salary: starting at $20 per hour depending on experience
* Benefits Package Available
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday

title: Patient Care Caller
description:
**Patient Care Caller**


Are you an organized, adaptable, and experienced communicator ready to make a difference in patient care? Join our team across five practices in Brooklyn and Queens as a Patient Care Caller.

**Responsibilities:**

* Reach out to patients via phone calls to follow up on their recent medical appointments or treatments.
* Listen attentively to patients' concerns, questions, and feedback regarding their care experience.
* Provide empathetic and knowledgeable responses to address patients' inquiries or escalate issues to appropriate personnel for resolution.
* Accurately and thoroughly document all interactions with patients in our database or electronic medical records system.
* Ensure compliance with all patient privacy and confidentiality regulations (e.g., HIPAA) during interactions.
* Participate in ongoing training to stay updated on healthcare procedures, policies, and best practices.
* Maintain a positive and supportive attitude towards patients, colleagues, and healthcare professionals.

  


**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in healthcare or customer service is a plus.
* Proven experience in a customer service or patient care role, preferably in a healthcare setting.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, conveying empathy and professionalism over the phone.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with patients from diverse backgrounds.
* Detail-oriented and organized, with multitasking and prioritization abilities.
* Proficiency in using computers and electronic medical records systems; familiarity with CRM software is advantageous.
* Ability to remain calm and composed in challenging or emotional situations.
* Commitment to upholding ethical standards and maintaining patient confidentiality.
* Flexibility to work shifts that may include evenings, weekends, or holidays based on operational needs.


Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Treatment Coordinator - Foreign Trained Dentist
description:
**Join Our Team as a Treatment Coordinator - Foreign Trained Dentist**  

  

New York Family Dentistry is seeking a highly motivated and skilled individual with a **foreign dental education** background to join our team as a Treatment Coordinator.


This role offers a fantastic career opportunity for **foreign-trained dentists** looking to advance their professional and personal experience.


As a Treatment Coordinator, you'll play a pivotal role in our continued success, contributing to our organizational workflow and working alongside talented professionals dedicated to excellence.

**Key Responsibilities**:

  

* Greet patients warmly, creating a welcoming atmosphere.

* Educate patients on the clinical benefits of dental treatment and explain insurance benefits and out-of-pocket costs.
* Collaborate with a team to assist patients with third-party financing Assist patients in completing financing applications and educate them on credit check processes.
* Creative problem-solving to help patients achieve their oral health needs. Documented
* Hand off paperwork to the front desk for processing and upload to patient charts.
* Leave comprehensive notes on treatment discussions, financial costs, and necessary prior approvals for efficient patient care.

**Why Join New York Family Dentistry:**

  

Be part of a company transforming the field of dentistry, and work with cutting-edge technology and industry experts to drive groundbreaking solutions. We iwill invest in your professional development and provide ample opportunities for advancement and learning.

This role provides competitive compensation and benefits, we offer a highly competitive salary package, comprehensive benefits, and additional perks to reward your hard work.

* High school diploma or equivalent

* Excellent knowledge of dental insurances, specifically PPO, DMO, DHMO (Capitation), and NYS Managed Care Program
* Experience in healthcare or sales setting

* Eligible to work in the US

  

Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Dental Receptionist - Queens Based
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional patient hospitality and making a positive impact on people's lives? New York Family Dentistry (NYFD) is excited to offer a unique opportunity for a Dental Receptionist to join our family-oriented team.


At NYFD, we prioritize creating lifelong positive experiences for our patients while fostering a supportive, engaging, and collaborative work environment.

title: Dental Patient Relations Specialist
description:
Join our team as a Patient Relations Specialist, enhancing patient experience across our offices in Brooklyn and Queens. Join a team that is focued on delivery the best patient experience to ensure that our patients keep returning for their oral health care.


Key Responsibilities:

**Enhance Patient Experience:** Resolve patient feedback and concerns promptly and efficiently via phone, text, and email.

**Conflict Resolution:** Own and manage all patient feedback programs, working closely with team. Implement strategies to resolve conflicts and enhance patient satisfaction.

**Analytics:** Collaborate with the team to develop reporting mechanisms and communication processes. Identify performance improvement opportunities for team members.

 **Remote Work:**

Why Join Us?

title: General Dentist - Available on Fridays
description:
Join Our Team: Exceptional General Dentist Wanted!


Are you ready to elevate your dental career to new heights? New York Family Dentistry is on a mission to expand the scope of care we offer to our diverse patient community, and we're searching for an outstanding General Dentist to join our dynamic team!


Why Join Us?


At New York Family Dentistry, we're more than just a dental practice – we're a passionate team dedicated to delivering exceptional care and creating beautiful smiles. When you join our family, you'll enjoy:

* A high market-competitive salary of $900 a day guaranteed, plus an enticing bonus structure
* Transportation subsidy to make your commute hassle-free
* Supportive and patient-focused team members who are committed to your success
* Access to the latest advancements in dental technology to enhance your practice
* An extensive and diverse patient base in the vibrant neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens
* A warm and welcoming family atmosphere with a strong emphasis on team training and development

**About the Role**


As a General Dentist at New York Family Dentistry, you'll harness the power of your clinical expertise and warm personality to deliver outstanding oral health care and unforgettable patient experiences. This role requires a deep commitment to patient care and the ability to collaborate seamlessly with our talented dental team.


If You Have These Amazing Qualities, You're the Perfect Fit:

* Caring and compassionate demeanor that puts patients at ease
* Patience and empathy to address our patients' diverse needs and concerns
* Excellent communication skills to connect authentically with patients and colleagues
* Strong problem-solving abilities to tackle any dental challenge with confidence
* Detail-oriented approach to ensure precision and excellence in every procedure
* Stellar time management and multitasking skills to thrive in our fast-paced environment

**Requirements**

* DDS or DMD from an accredited dental school
* Completion of an accredited dentistry residency program
* Active New York State Dental License
* Ability to work Fridays


If you're passionate about providing top-notch dental care and crave a supportive and friendly work environment, then look no further – you've found your perfect job! Submit your application today, along with your resume and cover letter, and take the next step in your dental career with New York Family Dentistry.


Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to make a difference – apply now and become a valued member of our team! And yes, our ideal candidate must be available to work every Saturday – because creating smiles knows no weekend breaks!

title: Dental Billing Specialist
description:
We seek a highly organized, adaptable, and experienced Dental Billing Specialist for our six practices in Brooklyn and Queens.


The Dental Billing Specialist is responsible for achieving the revenue targets of the practice. This person must have prior dental billing experience and be familiar with Government and Commercial Insurance plans.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Develop and Implement effective billing/collection policies and procedures
* Ensure compliance with government and third-party regulations
* Optimize insurance payer contract, pricing, and reimbursement rates
* Oversee timely claim submission and manage the aging process minimizing denials


- Conduct pre- and post-appointment audits

* Handle insurance calls and facilitate the correction of claims/refunds

 **Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of dental billing experience
* Proficiency in Dentrix Ascend, Google Workspace, Slack, and Asana
* Strong knowledge of PPO, DMO, DHMO, and NYS Managed Care Programs
* Understanding of in-network/out-of-network benefits and fee-for-service
* Up-to-date knowledge of ADA billing guidelines and CDT coding
* Strong knowledge of third party financing; Lending Club, Alphaeon, Care Credit, etc.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent critical thinking and organizational skills
* Positive attitude and strong problem-solving abilities

 **General Skills:**

* Proficiency in data entry and analysis
* Strong interpersonal skills and teamwork
* Ability to multitask and manage projects effectively


Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Mammography Technician
description:
## Job Summary  
We are seeking a skilled Mammography Technologist to join our medical team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for performing mammography procedures and assisting in the diagnosis of breast diseases.

## Duties  
- Conduct mammography screenings and diagnostic exams  
- Position patients correctly and operate mammography equipment  
- Ensure images are of high quality for accurate interpretation  
- Collaborate with radiologists and healthcare providers for patient care  
- Maintain patient records and ensure compliance with regulations

## Experience  
- Prior experience in mammography or related field preferred  
- Knowledge of urgent care, aseptic technique, and diagnostic radiology  
- Familiarity with medical terminology and physiology  
- Experience in emergency medicine, ER, or Level I Trauma Center is a plus  
- Proficiency in PET scans and diagnostic evaluation

Qualifications  
- Proficiency in PET scan, CT, and X-Ray imaging  
- Strong knowledge of Physiology, Medical terminology, and Anatomy  
- Experience in Mammography and DEXA scan procedures  
- Familiarity with Aseptic technique in medical imaging  
- Ability to work in an Urgent care setting and Level I Trauma Center  
- Knowledge of Nuclear medicine and Sonography is a plus

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $50.00 - $57.00 per hour

title: R&D Co-Op (Spring/Summer 2025)
description:
Job Description:
At GAF, we cover more than just buildings. We cover each other. Under this roof, you will have the tools and resources you need to begin, grow, and develop in your career. Under this roof, you will experience our incredible culture and be empowered to support your teammates, your customers and especially your community through collaboration. Under this roof, we define the future while leading the present through our commitment to continuous improvement and never being satisfied with the status quo. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.
Co-Opportunity/Internship is a chance for you to learn about your chosen field in a real work environment with experienced GAF professionals. You’ll be involved in high-profile projects as an integral member of our working teams. We offer full-time assignments to those students who are working toward undergraduate or graduate degrees in Chemical, Electrical, Mechanical engineering, or Industrial Engineering. Each assignment lasts a school term, and you may be invited to return to GAF for additional terms while you continue your education. You will receive a competitive salary and - depending on location - a temporary housing stipend.
Essential Duties:* Assistance in creating and or optimizing new inorganic coating technology.
* Prepare samples for analytical testing with a variety of sample preparation devices
* Use techniques including microscopy, titrations, color readings, total solar reflectivity, and others.
* Conduct problem-solving and troubleshooting investigations to assure root causes are identified and countermeasures and prevention are fully implemented
* Exporting, analyzing and organizing data


Requirements:* Must be pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry (preferred), Chemical Engineering (preferred), Engineering, or Materials Science
* All candidates must have a minimum 2.8 GPA, and at least sophomore standing
* Comfortable performing basic mathematical operations that are essential for chemistry applications (e.g. stoichiometry, determining the amount of moles of substance in a sample, solution making, etc.)
* Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer-sponsored visa (work permit)
* Problem solving, project management, collaboration and communication skills
* Must have ability to generate accurate and concise technical reports
* Proficient with office productivity tools: Microsoft Office Suite and Google (G-Suite)
* Familiarity with analytical methods of chemical quantification in either a lab or class setting is a plus.


Physical Requirements: Computer, ability to make oral presentations, lifting objects up to 30 lbs., standing or sitting for extended periods, extended or irregular hours, bending, kneeling, stooping, walking on uneven terrain. Must be able to wear all required personal protective equipment.
We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and GAF, Standard Logistics, SGI, and Siplast are proud to be affirmative action employers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. If applying for positions in the U.S., must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer sponsored visa (work permit).
company_description: GAF is a leader at imagining new and better ways to protect homes, buildings and infrastructures—while also protecting the environment.

title: Labor and Employment Counsel
description:
Job Description:
Introduction: At GAF, we cover more than buildings. We cover each other. No matter what role, tenure, or track, under this roof you are empowered to be there for your teammates, your customers, and especially your community. Under this roof, we don’t back down from hard work– we support one another in pursuit of something bigger. We define the future while leading the present. And under this roof, we own our opportunities. Becoming the market leader only happens when everyone feels they have the opportunity, and the support, to thrive. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.
Summary:
Working under the direction of the Senior Labor & Employment Counsel, and in collaboration with the General Counsel, GAF, and the Senior Vice President, Chief Labor and Employment Counsel, Standard Industries, the Labor & Employment Counsel is responsible for providing business-minded legal counsel to internal clients, for all aspects of labor & employment law.
Essential Duties:* Being the primary employment contact for one or more business units
* Partnering with and providing counseling and support to colleagues on all day-to-day employee relations matters, including recruiting, hiring, employee discipline, performance management, terminations, and restructurings
* Partnering with and providing counseling and support regarding labor relations matters, including advising on contract administration and assisting in handling labor arbitrations
* Drafting, revising, and counseling on employment related agreements and policies including offer letters, severance agreements, confidentiality and non-compete agreements, benefit programs, employee handbook policies, and employee relations documentation
* Defending and representing the company in administrative charges pending with the EEOC, DOL, NLRB, and state and federal agencies, by conducting investigations, document reviews, drafting and submitting position statements, and appearing for any hearings or mediations, and managing outside counsel where appropriate
* Providing legal guidance and counsel to the company’s Human Resources professionals related to internal investigations arising from complaints in order to lead these matters to resolution
* Handling pre-litigation claims, settlement negotiations and mediations, and federal and state litigation, including management of outside counsel where support is needed
* Monitoring labor, employment and benefits law developments and recommending changes to company policies to the Senior Labor & Employment Counsel
* Providing legal support for diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts, including affirmative action plan initiatives
* Developing and providing training related to labor & employment law issues to management and Human Resources professionals


Under This Roof, We Require:* 4-6 years of experience at a major law firm; in-house legal experience and/or human resources experience a plus
* Juris Doctor, with strong academic record
* Member in good standing of the New Jersey state bar or any state bar that would enable admission to practice as in-house counsel in New Jersey l
* Advanced knowledge of Title VII, ADA, ADEA, FMLA, FLSA, WARN, NLRA, OSHA, and other state and federal employment laws, as well as employment related claims, contract issues, common law claims, and restrictive covenant matters that arise in the employment context
* Willing and able to travel up to 20%, or as needed


Under This Roof, We Also Value:* Familiarity with DOT, ERISA, MSHA, and/or OFCCP regulations a plus
* Self-motivated, with ability to work efficiently, either independently or in a team environment
* Advanced communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to explain legal concepts to non-lawyers
* Ability to handle a high volume of work and juggle multiple matters simultaneously
* Excellent business judgment and ability to assess legal risk while also thinking strategically and providing practical advice
* Maintain strict confidence and discretion, and a friendly and professional demeanor in all aspects of work duties
* Advanced proficiency with Google Suite (gmail, sheets, slides, docs)
* Advanced organizational skills with an eye for detail

How We Protect What Matters Most* We offer a wide range of health insurance options that include medical, dental, and vision for you and your family.
* Our Family-Building benefits support the many different journeys to fertility and parenthood.
* Our robust 401K plan includes an employer match contribution with your pre-tax and/or Roth contributions.
* Other exciting programs and perks are available to help employees achieve work-life balance, including (but not limited to) a wellness program, free financial coaching, a referral program, and product rebates when purchased for an employee’s primary residence.
* Professional growth and development are very important to us! We offer internal training programs and courses, as well as a generous tuition reimbursement program.
* We put diversity and inclusion into action with our Employee Resource Groups, which unite employees based on common perspectives, identities, demographic factors, or out of a desire to be an ally.


GAF complies with federal, state, and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If a reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact HR Services at 833-HR-XPERT.
We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and GAF, Standard Logistics, SGI, and Siplast are proud to be affirmative action employers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. If applying for positions in the U.S., must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer sponsored visa (work permit).

title: Service Apprentice- Plainfield Gas
description:
**Requisition**: 79766


**PSEG Company:** Public Service Electric & Gas Co.

**Salary Range**: $ 24.814 - $ 42.126

**Incentive**: Not applicable

**Work Location Category**: Onsite

  

PSEG operates under a Flexible Work Model where flexible work is offered when job requirements allow. In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.


We want you to be healthy, balanced, and feel secure. That’s why you’ll enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits, with a focus on supporting your whole health. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer a retirement program, 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement and a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year.


PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG.


**Union Local**
---------------

**Summary**
-----------


Under general supervision in the field, installs meters, service regulators, appliances, and associated pipings maintains gas installations and appliances as qualified through formalized and/or on-the-job training, carries through assignments, at times with the assistance of other employees; under general supervision in the shop, does other Service Department work.

**Job Duties & Responsibilities**
---------------------------------


Performs duties such as: Performs such work as:  

1. Installing, renewing, and repairing gas piping on customers' premises; extending service piping, installing meter spacings; setting meters on new spacings, including the fitting of pipe from meter outlet connection to house piping; checking completed work for tightness and compliance with Company's specifications, including the piping installed by plumbers.  

2. Installing all types of gas appliances and turning on for normal operation.  

3. Installing, inspecting, and changing service regulators; testing and adjusting operation of service regulators in the field, excluding industrial regulators used in complicated installations.  

4. Making repairs to and installing repair parts on non-automatic appliances such as water heaters, space heaters, and ranges, excluding repairs to and installation of electrically operated controls; making repairs to, and installing those repair parts on automatic type appliances which do not involve the adjustment of automatic gas controls.  

5. Clearing services and house piping of stoppages with or without the use of compressed gasses or vacuum tank, investigating complaints of no gas, insufficient gas at customers' premises, correcting same.  

6. Taking and interpreting U-gauge pressure readings in order to locate small leaks and stoppages in service and house piping, and in order to determine adequacy of such piping.  

7. Setting or removing pressure or temperature recording gauges, on customers' premises.  

8. Stopping flow of gas by such methods as inserting rags or expansion plugs.  

9. Shutting off, cleaning and re-lighting central building heating furnaces and boilers.  

10. Re-lighting residential, commercial and industrial appliances in conjunction with active orders, meter change work and Street Department work.  

11. Making simple sketches of piping and equipment layout on customers' premises to explain unusual condition to supervisor in shop.  

12. Investigating gas leaks at customers' premises, using approved devices; making same safe.

**Years of Experience**
-----------------------

**Job Qualifications**
----------------------

* High school diploma or GED
* Must have a valid U. S. driver's license and maintain a satisfactory driving record
* Must successfully pass the hiring tests administered by the Company (Gas Battery Test)
* Per the Bargaining Unit Contract, this position has a 5 year lock-in period.


Desired:  

Universal Refrigeration Certification  

Experience in plumbing, pipefitting, HVAC, or appliance repair trades

**Education**
-------------


High School**Licenses or Certifications**
------------------------------

**Training and Courses**
------------------------

As an employee of PSEG you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

  

For all roles, PSEG’s drug and alcohol testing program includes pre-employment testing, testing for cause, and post-incident/accident testing. For employees in federally regulated roles (including positions covered by USDOT, PHMSA, or NRC regulations), this also includes random testing. Although numerous states throughout the country have legalized marijuana/cannabis products recreationally and/or medically, it is prohibited for employees in federally regulated roles. Employees who are hired or transfer into a federally regulated role are subject to drug and alcohol testing, inclusive of marijuana. Please note that the use of CBD products may result in a positive drug test for THC/Marijuana and such use is not a legitimate medical explanation for such a positive result.

**Job Summary**
---------------


Create and maintain mapping products including civil engineering deliverables, and records utilizing automated mapping and GIS technologies at a technical level, not considered professional. Using source engineering and land title documents, extracting relevant data to support the project assigned. Perform civil engineering/surveying calculations using established processes, using geometry and algebra.


Atleast 8x a month in-office expectation.

**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Analyze client verbal requests for mapping support, assess available data and recommend appropriate mapping/cartographic workflows and processes for creation of suitable mapping deliverables.

-------------------------------

**Required**

* High School Diploma or Equivalent.
* 3 year of experience in plan preparation using Microstation, or the equivalent CAD or GIS, in a networked environment with file management experience at the user level.
* Experience with Microsoft Office applications, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

**Desired**

* Associates Degree
* Strong spatial and mathematical ability.
* Proficiency in the use of Computer Mapping software, e.g. Microstation, OpenRoads, OpenCities, image management software, rendering & visualization applications, Geo-spatial Information System software, e.g. ArcGIS and associated modules.
* 5 years of experience in plan preparation using Microstation, or the equivalent CAD or GIS, in a networked environment with file management experience at the user level.
* Formal training in Land Surveying, Civil Engineering, Cartography or Automated Mapping and image processing for mapping and Cadastral Surveying Calculations.

PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. **Job Summary**
---------------


Plans, leads, organizes, negotiates and acquires all necessary federal and state new and modified environmental permits for the PSEG Development projects, Construction and Operations groups. Provides regulatory guidance on all related issues to assist with overall development and ongoing compliance. Act as the Subject Matter Expert to obtain necessary information to provide input to permit decisions and new generation planning. Interface with regulatory agencies to negotiate permitting strategies and policy issues. Develop and maintain permitting plans, schedules and budgets for permitting activities. Prepare procedures, guidance and aids to facilitate compliance with Federal, State, local and internal regulatory and environmental requirements. Develop and prepare reports to Federal and State regulatory agencies. Design and implement effective and economic compliance strategies. Manage consultants and maintain effective relationships with regulatory agencies. Identify and evaluate compliance trends and recommend corrective action or system improvements.

**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Plan, organize, negotiate and acquires all necessary federal and state new and modified environmental permits for the Renewables /Offshore Wind Development, Construction and Operations groups.
* Act as the Subject Matter Expert to obtain necessary information to provide input to permit decisions and new generation planning
* Interface with regulatory agencies to negotiate permitting strategies and policy issues.
* Develop and maintain permitting plans, schedules and budgets for permitting activities. Prepare procedures, guidance and aids to facilitate compliance with Federal, State, local and internal regulatory and environmental requirements.
* Develop and prepare reports to Federal and State regulatory agencies.
* Manage consultants and maintain effective relationships with regulatory agencies.
* Identify and evaluate compliance trends and recommend corrective action or system improvements.
**Job Specific Qualifications**
-------------------------------

* Bachelor's degree; 10 years experience - Engineering, Environmental Science or related field

  

  

**Other Qualifications:**

* Experienced in effective management of environmental consultants / contractors.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Candidate must foster an inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity.
* Successful candidate must demonstrate and value differences in others' strengths, perspectives, approaches, and personal choices.

**Desired:**

* Environmental experience in New Jersey, Connecticut, New York, Delaware and Maryland
* A comprehensive understanding of Federal and State regulations in the area of responsibility (e.g., air, water, waste, remediation, land use permitting)
* Direct Federal and State permitting experience in New Jersey
* NEPA Federal level experience

title: Research Assistant
description:
I am looking for a research assistant who can go to the New York Public Library’s Stephen A. Schwarzman Building to find a newspaper article. (Fifth Avenue and 42nd Street  
New York, NY 10018) I have the details about what it is and how to request it, but I am not local to the area, and it would be cost prohibitive for me to fly to NYC for this. The article is on an old microfilm and not available for any kind of digital access or digital download.

Deliverable:  
+ You will need to access the article I provide to you and make a copy for me. If you use your cell phone and make clear photos that is fine. Or you can take a notepad and transcribe the text. Whatever you are allowed to do in the library.

This work will be performed on a freelance, 1099 basis. Choose your own hours - no micromanagement. As long as you can produce the deliverable, I am very open!

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary

Pay: $15.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10018 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Full Time - Head Cashier - Day
description:
**Essential Functions:**  

**NOTE:** Minors in this role may not be responsible for some of the activities listed below  

Assisted Self Check Out  

* Demonstrates ability to monitor and identify customers who need assistance at multiple self-checkout registers simultaneously
* Approaches and interacts with customers to proactively recommend products and services appropriately
* Proactively greets, assists, and engages with multiple customers on multiple registers at the same time
* Moves throughout the checkout area standing, walking, reaching, bending, lifting, and moving product to ensure accurate completion of transactions
* Thanks the customer for their business and invites them back to shop at Lowe’s

  

**Customer Service**  

* Provides SMART customer service at all times through the daily execution of Lowe's customer service policies, procedures and programs
* Seeks out customers to understand his/her needs and assists in locating, demonstrating, selecting, carrying, and/or loading merchandise
* Listens to and responds knowledgeably and promptly to customer and employee questions by taking them to areas of the store and walking them through projects when necessary
* Demonstrates sincere appreciation to customers
* Communicates information to customers regarding all stock, special order merchandise, feature benefits, application, and warranty information related to Lowe’s programs
* Coaches, develops, provides feedback, and trains associates in the various departmental duties or sales opportunities
* Uses a cash register to process sales transactions, returns, and refunds according to company guidelines
* Provides proper monetary change to CSA Front End associates for register activities
* Provides supervision, coaching, and support to CSA Front End Team (Front End/Loaders)
* Removes security tags, verifies product information, and bags merchandise for customers
* Answers incoming phone calls and directs calls or takes messages as needed
* Opens additional registers, when necessary, to ensure enough coverage always
* Assists in line vesting to help quicker turnaround time for checkout

  

**In-stock**  

* Prepares register area at the beginning and end of shift by confirming functionality of registers and scanners and stocking register supplies
* Inspects returned merchandise for damages
* Enters and submits customer orders, prints order tickets, verifies receipts, and signs off on loading tickets
* Reviews and places online orders and returned merchandise in the appropriate areas
* Looks up product information and competitor prices for products to verify price match
* Records all items that are used in the store on the store use lists

  

**Clean and Safe Stores**  

* Obtains safety bags from the cash office and monitors the amount of cash in the drawers to ensure it does not exceed requirements
* Monitors merchandise entering and leaving the store entrances and exits and assists customers or associates who trigger the alarm
* Detects common signs of shoplifting, theft, and other security risks, and promptly communicates them to management and/or Asset Protection
* Ensures compliance with housekeeping standards and programs (e.g., Zone Recovery) to maintain cleanliness and organization of store and working areas
* Maintains a safe and secure work environment, which may include conducting daily safety reviews, noting hazards, keeping aisles clear, and securing doors and gates
* Adheres to all safety requirements relevant to one’s regular job duties: top stock safety, reinstalling safety cables, use of aisle blockers, a tether line on power equipment, spotters, and safety devices
* Operates store equipment as needed depending on one specific role and department (e.g., Zebra phone, telephone, paging system, copiers, fax machines, computers, CCTV surveillance system, key cutter, panel saw, paint mixer, flooring cutters, compacter baler)

  

**General**  

* In addition to the above responsibilities, this individual is held accountable for other duties as assigned

  

**Minimum Requirements:**  

* Less than 1 year of experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
* Less than 1 year of experience using common retail technology, such as smart phones and tablets
* 1 to 2 years of retail experience as a cashier
* Must be able to lift items weighing up to 15 pounds with or without a reasonable accommodation

  

**Preferences**:  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* 1 to 2 years of experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, protection plans, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits
* 1 to 2 years of experience as a head cashier
* 1 to 2 years of experience working in any department at a Lowe's retail store
* 1 to 2 years of supervisory experience in any field, including directing, delegating, evaluating, training, and coaching employees
* Less than a year of retail experience detecting common signs of shoplifting (e.g., merchandise hidden inside of containers, merchandise under carts, price labels switched)
*Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*

title: Membership Sales Advisor, Midtown
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.


OUR CODE:


We are passionate about high-performance living and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a disruptive approach to unleash it. We dream big and don’t settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than 110% to help each other deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, what’s next. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company.


If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description**  

Equinox is seeking **Membership Sales Advisors** for our state-of-the-art locations in **Midtown NYC!**


Membership Advisors are responsible for achieving or exceeding individual sales goals, renewals and ancillary service goals by pre-planning the month with strategic outreach, in-club lead generation and securing member referrals. Under the management of a General Manager, the support of a Regional Manager and a sales team of 3-4 individuals, Advisors must display, have knowledge of and participate in all the club's services, programs, and products. Advisors must keep current in knowledge of key competitors by staying abreast of trends and “shopping” competitors to compare facilities and sales trends. Above all, Advisors must have the ability to build rapport and lasting relationships with prospective and current members in order to build a strong referral base and retain members.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Responsible for selling club memberships
* Prospect new business and clients
* Host events and workshops for in-club lead generation
* Achieve or exceed individual sales goals, renewals and ancillary service goals
* Conduct pre-planning activities each month including strategic outreach, for securing member referrals
* Build rapport and lasting relationships with prospective and current members
* Under the leadership of a General Manager, the support of a Regional Sales Manager and a sales team, Advisors must display, have knowledge of and participate in all the club's services, programs, and products

  

**Qualifications**  

* Previous sales experience preferred
* An entrepreneurial spirit
* Confidence to perform on an incentive based salary
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Enthusiastic, energetic, personable and friendly disposition
* Personal passion for health and fitness
* Enjoy working within a team
* Strong time management skills and practices
* Willing and able to work evenings, weekends and holidays
* **Pay Transparency: $17 Hourly. Variable bonus and commission plans allow for a potential total compensation of $80,000-$100,000 for reaching sales targets.**

  

**Additional Information** **AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop

**NOTE**: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.


Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at**https://careers.equinox.com/**


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: SEO Coordinator, Part-Time
description:
Job Description :
The New York Post delivers the best in News, Sports, Entertainment and Pop Culture with wit, irreverence and authority. Over the past 223 years, The Post has evolved into a multi-platform media company spanning print, digital, video, audio, app, television and commerce.
We are seeking an SEO Coordinator (Part-Time) to join the SEO team at The New York Post. Reporting into the Director of SEO, this role will collaborate closely with department stakeholders across the New York Post, Page Six, and Decider to implement effective content optimization strategies, while leading the company’s initiative with Google News Showcase. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on the growing digital presence of one of the world’s leading news organizations.  

Responsibilities include:* Spearhead the New York Post’s Google News Showcase strategy by curating daily story panels that effectively promote the company’s reporting and voice in Google News and Google Discover
* Work closely with editorial teams to provide on- and off-page optimization recommendations and develop keyword-targeted content
* Perform keyword research to identify coverage gaps and emerging trends across various sections, and pitch content ideas to editorial stakeholders
* Collaborate with SEO and editorial team members to develop content strategies for evergreen, timely, and event-based content
* Copy edit and audit written articles for SEO best practices
* Monitor and track reporting on traffic and rankings
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends and Google’s web standards, and translate them into workable solutions


The ideal candidate will have/be:* 1-2 years’ experience working in-house in SEO and editorial; a background in digital news is preferred
* A passion for digital news, SEO, and content strategy
* Experience with WordPress, HTML, and competitive SEO tools (SEMrush, Google Trends, Search Console, Google Analytics) is a plus
* Availability to work evening and weekend hours
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively balance priorities and collaborate with cross-functional teams
* Detail-oriented mindset with strong organizational and project management skills
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment


Note: The New York Post adheres to a hybrid work model.
Shift: Three (3) days per week from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm or 8:30 am to 4:30 pm.
NYC Pay Range: $20 per hour to $25 per hour.
At The New York Post we recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company. As a result, our ranges reflect our good faith estimate to pay fairly as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate’s experience, industry knowledge, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.
As an equal opportunity employer, the New York Post does not discriminate in hiring or the terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. The New York Post will consider the provision of reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental disabilities of otherwise qualified applicants to enable them to participate in our application process and to effectively perform the essential functions of the job, unless doing so would impose an undue financial or operational hardship.
Pay Range: $20.00 - $25.00

title: Registered Nurse - Field Clinician - Fairfield County, CT
description:
**$5,000 Sign on Bonus for external candidates**



For those who want to invent the future of health care, here's your opportunity. We're going beyond basic care to health programs integrated across the entire continuum of care. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

  

The Senior Community Care (SCC) program is a longitudinal, integrated care delivery program that coordinates the delivery and provision of clinical care of members in a facility setting. The Optum Care Team RN within SCC provides care to our highest-risk health plan members and is part of an interdisciplinary team consisting of an Advanced Practice Clinician (APC) and a Patient Care Coordinator (PCC). In this role you will have the ability to achieve work life balance. No on-call, no weekends, and no holidays required.

  

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Ensure accurate and complete documentation
* Communicate and collaborate with the interdisciplinary care team
* Collaborate and communicate with PCC to support APC care and scheduling of member
* Assist the provider/team with various care coordination activities
* Assist the provider/team with benefit determination associated with Medicare part A, part B, and part D benefits
* Responsible for collaborating with the primary APC and facility to identify and respond to patient change in condition
* Assist the provider/team with therapy coordination
* Participate in facility-based meetings
* Schedule and participate in family conferences, team meetings, and team case presentations
* Coordination of training, tracking, and compliance with quality measures
* Assist in creating and conduct in-services for selected audiences
* Assist Providers in assuring complete and accurate documentation and coding, medication reconciliation, nursing rounds, assessment, and patient documentation
* May write verbal orders from Provider in the chart in compliance with the state RN practice laws, and in compliance with individual nursing facility practices
* Assist in managing members through an acute medical situation or an exacerbation of a chronic condition, including testing, diagnostics, interventions
* Assist in managing members during a short term sub-acute rehabilitation episode

  



You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Associate degree or higher in Nursing (RN)
* Active and unrestricted license in the state which you reside, or ability to obtain by start date
* Certified in Basic Life Support
* Ability to complete physical requirements, including lifting a 30-pound bag and ability to perform physical assessment
* Ability to travel in between facilities
* Access to reliable transportation

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* 1+ years of clinical experience in practice (acute care setting preferred)
* Experience in meeting the medical needs of patients with complex behavioral, social and/or functional needs
* Saline Lock insertion experience
* Understanding of Geriatrics and Chronic Illness

  


**Connecticut Residents Only:** The hourly range for this role is $28.03 to $54.95 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

*OptumCare is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*
company_description: Optum is a health services and innovation company on a mission to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.

title: Buyer/Planner
description:
**Position Summary:**


Catalent Pharma Solutions in Somerset, NJ is hiring for a Buyer/Planner for the Supply Chain team. This role is primarily responsible for indirect and direct material procurement, delivery, and confirmation of the delivery and release to support the Master Production Schedule. The Buyer/Planner requires a multifaceted skill set involving procurement, supply chain management, inventory control, supplier relationship management, and quality assurance

**This is a full-time 1st shift position: Monday – Friday, 8:00AM – 5:00PM**


Catalent is a global, high-growth, public company, and a leading partner for the pharmaceutical industry in the development and manufacturing of new treatments for patients worldwide. Your talents, ideas, and passion are essential to our mission: to help people live better, healthier lives. Catalent in Somerset, NJ is home to oral solid dose manufacturing operations as part of the Oral and Specialty Delivery (OSD) business unit. On site we have our state-of-the-art laboratory, clinical, and commercial manufacturing plant for oral dose forms in addition to being the Catalent Center of Excellence for handling Highly Potent Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients.

**Catalent is committed to a Patient First culture through excellence in quality and compliance, and to the safety of every patient, consumer, and Catalent employee.**

**The Role:**

* Responsible for the supply of all materials to support production at Somerset facility
* Identify issues and resolves problems regarding materials. Supports problem resolution and communication to all affected internal departments.
* Lead investigations related to material discrepancies and Trackwise events
* Generate and issues purchase orders (PO) to Suppliers within JDE in accordance with Approved Suppliers and ensures timely approval of PO’s with associated approval chain
* Maintain trackers of Order status, PO status, lead time, and receipt for all goods
* Source new suppliers, vendors, distributors as needed based on input from Formulations and Operations
* Monitor and adjust open PO’s and supplier commitments
* Resolves 3-way match issues to ensure timely supplier payment.
* Maintain inventory levels consistent with site policies and goals. Quarterly adjusts safety stock levels in JDE based on self-analysis of inventory levels
* Review excess & obsoletes inventory and provides supporting data to seek customer reimbursement for customer owned materials.
* Process materials for shipment including material samples and supports shipment documentation preparation.
* All other duties as assigned;

**The Candidate:**

* High School Diploma or GED is required, Bachelors Degree or Associates Degree in life science, supply chain, or business is preferred
* With a Bachelors degree, 2 or more years of experience in a similar role are required
* With an Associates or High School Diploma/GED, 4 or more years of experience in a similar role is required
* 2 or more years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry, or the ability to demonstrate adequate knowledge of controls and requirements in a pharmaceutical environment is required
* 1or more years previous experience working with MRP systems is required
* Strong background in procurement, vendor management, and negotiations is strongly preferred
* APICS Certification is preferred
* Ability to read, understand and action MRP reports, stock status reports material variance reports is required
* Knowledge JD Edwards systems or other ERP/MRP Systems and pharmaceutical related materials management is required
* Individual may be required to sit, stand, walk regularly and occasionally lift 0-15 pounds

**Why You Should Join Catalent:**

* Defined career path and annual performance review and feedback process
* Diverse, inclusive culture
* 152 hours of PTO + 8 paid holidays
* 401K program with match
* Several Employee Resource Groups focusing on D&I
* Dynamic, fast-paced work environment
* Positive working environment focusing on continually improving processes to remain innovative
* Potential for career growth on an expanding team within an organization dedicated to preserving and bettering lives
* Competitive salary
* Community engagement and green initiatives
* Medical, dental and vision benefits effective day one of employment
* Tuition Reimbursement – Let us help you finish your degree or earn a new one!
* WellHub program to promote overall physical wellness
* Perkspot - offers exclusive or private discounts from approximately 900+ merchants in a wide array of categories

**Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career!** Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference.


personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.


Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.


Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veterans.


If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.

  

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Catalent Pharma Solutions (Catalent) is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Catalent. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.


Important Security Notice to U.S. Job Seekers:


Catalent NEVER asks candidates to provide any type of payment, bank details, photocopies of identification, social security number or other highly sensitive personal information during the offer process, and we NEVER do so via email or social media. If you receive any such request, DO NOT respond— it is a fraudulent request. Please forward such requests to spam@catalent.com for us to investigate with local authorities.


California Job Seekers can find our California Job Applicant Notice HERE.

title: Agile Coach
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
The SDLC, Agile Coach is a member of the Enterprise Business Technology Solutions (EBTS), Strategy and Enablement team and is a subject matter expert providing leadership, guidance, and coaching to drive our Agile transformation. This key role will guide and train the EBTS organization as it adopts Agile values and practices to enhance their delivery of critical business initiatives. The Agile Coach is an organizational change agent who embraces an Agile mindset and cultivates it throughout the organization.
Practitioner and Practice Coach* Maintains industry expertise and certifications in Agile methodologies, leverages knowledge to drive best practices.
* Coach software delivery teams in the application of modern development practices.
* Champion Agile principles, scrum practices, and overall operating model effectiveness across the organization.
* Lead Agile workshops to drive adoption of standard practices and ceremonies
* Foster collaboration and drive cultural change within and across Agile teams.
* Defines KPI’s, leverages measures and metrics to drive effectiveness.
* Recruits and partners with Agile evangelists across EBTS to promote continual learning and maturity of Agile practices.


Training and Development* Create and maintain the enterprise Agile learning roadmap to support Horizon’s adoption strategy.
* Develop and manage the Agile Training/University program.
* Designing training curriculum, materials, and exams.
* Conduct Agile training classes, both in-person and virtual, for staff of all levels.
* Facilitate learning through workshops, meet-ups, and team building activities.
* Teach participants to interpret Agile productivity measures and understand options for improving velocity.
* Define KPIs and metrics to assess effectiveness.
* Communicates progress against objectives.
* Establish trusted working relationships with IT and business colleagues while advancing the level of Agile maturity in the organization.
* Embrace and model the concept of continuous learning for others.


Required* HSD or GED required, Bachelor degree preferred
* 4+ years’ experience in using Agile methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Kanban, RUP, SAFe).
* Experience with implementing enterprise Agile transformation programs.


Additional licensing, certifications, registrations:* One or more Agile certifications preferred e.g. PMI-ACP, CSM, CSPO, CSP, (or similar).


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:* Working knowledge of and experience using Jira and Confluence Ability to tailor coaching techniques to individuals as needed Knowledge of Agile engineering practices including DevSecOps CI-SD Pipelines Ability to manage hybrid environments during Agile transition/adoption.
* Excellent communication and facilitation skills.
* Ability to communicate complex concepts in business terms.
* Strong emotional intelligence and organizational awareness with the ability to challenge status quo and influence outcomes.
* Team builder mentality


Salary Range:
$106,400 - $145,215
This compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. This range has been created in good faith based on information known to Horizon at the time of posting. Compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. Horizon also provides a comprehensive compensation and benefits package which includes:* Comprehensive health benefits (Medical/Dental/Vision)
* Retirement Plans
* Generous PTO
* Incentive Plans
* Wellness Programs
* Paid Volunteer Time Off
* Tuition Reimbursement


Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability and any other protected class as required by federal, state or local law. Horizon will consider reasonable accommodation requests as part of the recruiting and hiring process.

title: Lead Business Execution Consultant - Tax Utility
description:
**About this role:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Business Execution Consultant to join its Tax Utility team. Learn more about the career areas and business divisions at wellsfargojobs.com.  

  

This team owns systems around tax reporting. The selected individual will be responsible for writing requirements, user testing, production management, issue management, all within customer tax.
  

  

**In this role, you will:*** Lead cross functional teams to strategize, plan, and execute a variety of programs, services and initiatives
* Drive accountability for assigned initiatives, limit risk exposure, and create efficiencies as appropriate
* Review strategic approaches and effectiveness of support function and business performance
* Perform assessments through fact finding and data requiring creative approaches to solving complex issues, and develop appropriate solutions or recommendations
* Make decisions in highly complex and multifaceted situations requiring solid understanding of business group's functional area or products, facilitate decision making and issue resolution, and support implementation of developed solutions and plans
* Collaborate and consult with members of the Business Execution team and team leaders to drive strategic initiatives
* Influence, guide and lead less experienced Strategy and Execution staff within the group

**Required Qualifications:*** 5+ years of Business Execution, Implementation, or Strategic Planning experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

**Desired Qualifications:*** Testing and production management experience
* Issue management experience
* Customer tax experience and understanding of 1099 reporting
* Experience with Agile
* Experience with Jira and writing requirements/user stories
* Strong risk and control fundamentals experience, to include control design execution
* Experience leading or participating in enterprise-wide initiatives that reach multiple lines of businesses
* Experience in compliance or operational risk management including knowledge and understanding of associated risk management policies
* Experience providing "credible challenge" to business partners, when necessary, with the ability to lead through influence
* Good analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
* Able to think strategically and pivot between multiple priorities
* Experience skillfully building constructive and effective relationships
* Delivers on commitments and renegotiates when needed
* Strong sense of accountability
* Program and project management skills
* Advanced experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, SharePoint

**Job Expectations:*** This position offers a hybrid work schedule

11 Sep 2024

**We Value Diversity**  

  

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.  

  

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.
